UPDATED: JUL 5, 2015 Pours a dark brown colour, looks like a Porter. Nice tan head and lots of tan lacing... a nice looking beer. Heavy pine aroma, almost Christmas tree, with a hint of malt. Nice balanced flavor, citrus hops (orange) and nice toasted malt with a hint of chocolate and molasses. Easy to drink, this is a good beer.
Pours black with a thin tan head. Aroma hints slightly at cocoa but is mostly pine hops. Taste is hoppy.

A black ipa with almost a stout palate with stronger cocoa hints than I've ever had in such a hoppy beer. As I continue to drink it I see there's a crispness to this that's impressive in such a strong beer. Well-crafted!

651 ml. bottle. Pours a medium, well retained, beige head, with extensive lacing, over a clear dark brown (SRM 25) body......nose is pine, resin, citrus hints, cocoa, chocolate, well balanced........taste is slightly sweet, with roasted malts, including cocoa, light chocolate, light hints of toffee/caramel, leading to pine,resin, finishing with a moderate bitterness......mouthfeel, heavy of medium body, slight stickiness, alcohol warmth present, carbonation makes for heavy creaminess. This has every characteristic a Black IPA should have. The malts are complex and deep with heavy roast notes and mid level sweetness. The hops are complex and thoroughly American as befits a style created in this country. BJCP 9/3/16/5/8

Bottle. Very dark brown, near black pour with a thick froth of tan foam. Dense hop bitterness with some background chocolate and resinous pine in the aroma. Nice combination of chocolate roast, hop bitterness, and sharp pine in the taste with some lingering malt sweetness. Relatively dry finish for the IIPA-level ABV. Im impressed.

22 oz. bomber, nice black pour with a one finger, light tan head that maintains and leaves good lacing. Aroma of molasses, roasted grain, basement (musty), brown sugar, and slight sour aromas. The flavor showcases the high alpha hops, with ample bitterness and a piney, resinous character. Hints of raisin and dark fruit. Medium body with a sticky texture, medium carbonation and a dry, bitter finish. I like it OK but its not one of my preferred styles, a bit too bitter for my palate, but interesting nonetheless.
Black pour with a huge off white head, almost tan. Aroma is very bright, full of sugar and citrus. Mouth is very full. Taste is full of citrus, roast, chocolate and ends bitter. Creamy mouth.
Bottle. Pours a nice lighter coffee black with a huge head. Nice roast and malt nose. Clean rich roasty taste. Very well balanced and a pleasant lingering finish.

4oz on draft. Dark brown with nice light brown head. Malty aroma with pine notes. Impressive balance of toasted malts and pine hops. Definitely a beer I want to have a pint of sometime in the future. I wish it were available in more locations in Canada. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 oz. bottle, pours jet black with a medium tan head. Aroma is a little chalky, with slight roast and piney hops. Flavour is rich and well-balanced, with loads of piney hops and roasted malt. Dry, hoppy and roasted. Awesome textbook black IPA.

Bottle. Pours a deep dark brown with a huge bubbly tan head that lingers. Big aroma, of toasted malt, dark chocolate, grass, wood, hops. Sharp taste, of wood, roasted malt, toast, bitter dark chocolate, pine hops, coffee. Lingering toast. Very nice, rich dark IPA.

This was poured into a pint glass.
The appearance had a nice jet black color with a fairly decent one finger off white to slight tan foamy head that lasted for about a minute before it dissipated. Once it did, there were some light spider web lacings all around.
The smell had a really nice bitter citrus up front with a fairly decent bitter coffee doing the best it can to back it up.
The taste was mainly sweet but carried a tad of bitterness to impart a slight invasive and inviting real coffee flavored black IPA.
On the palate, this one sat right at a medium on the body. I say this was good for the style and actually it came across fairly smooth and not as sharp as expected.
Overall, very good black IPA, but doesnt compare to Baranofs which in my opinion is the best on the market or at least on the west coast.

Poured from a 22 ounce bomber. The aroma has citrus, melon, pine hop notes. The malts are subtle in the aroma, slight roasty notes. The flavor is fruity, melon, roasted malts, cocoa notes are subtle. Very nice black IPA.

Bottle: Dark brown pour with about two fingers of creamy brown head. Good retention throughout and sticky lacing. Grapefruit and piney nose, light cocoa and moderate roast. The grapefruit and cocoa come through more in the taste, its sort of sweet, but hoppy enough to keep the grapefruit and pine on the forefront. Nice stuff.

On draft at Fat Heads Brewers Brawl

I actually had no intentions of stopping by Lagunitas except that their booth was one of a few with no line. This release, fresh from the brewery in Chicago, shows that they continue to excel. How they can make such nice beers and keep a low price point in a crowded market is beyond me. Whatever they are doing I hope they keep it up.

Aroma / Appearance - A creamy black base swirls fluidly around the glass. Little bursts of carbonation escape from time to time. Malt, chocolate, and the smells of rustic hops bring to mind a remote cabin in the woods where a pot of coffee has been left too long to brew.

Flavor / Palate - Smooth from start to finish, the texture is well balanced. Earthy coffee, malt, and balanced hops emerge after just a few sips. Not the usual beer I would go for on a steamy summer afternoon it still manages to capture the essence of a black IPA perfectly. Grab a bottle and try it for yourself.

Bomber from Supermarket Liquors. Appearance: 2 fingers milk chocolate head, dark brown color, ok lacing. Aroma: pine, grass, grapefruit, light roast. Palate: medium to full body, average carbonation, bitter finish, sticky texture. Taste: light sweet pine, like sap, and then, briefly into light grassy bitter, about face into heavy pine bitterness. Overall, the pine is just right in this, not too much, but definitely the focus. Different for a black IPA and very good.
22oz bottle. Black pour with a frothy tan head. Flavors are biscuit, caramel, roasted malts, dark chocolate, pine resin and grapefruit. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture.

Bottle. Dark brown beer with a tan head. Grapefruit and light pine aroma with light tropical fruit. Grapefruit and tropical fruit flavor with light pine. Medium bodied. Grapefruit and tropical fruit linger with light pine and light malt.
Great value. I enjoy Black IPAs and I certainly enjoyed this one as well. Great balance of hops and malt, coffee flavors intensified as beer warmed. Another awesome beer from Lagunitas.

Flaske: Lækker duft af citrus og klassisk ipa. Farven er bare lidt forkert og smagen lidt for brændt. Sort IPA er bare ikke min stil. Trods alt er dette dog stadig et godt eksempel på denne stil og da det er min eneste nye rating fra Lagunitas på denne tur er der en hvis nostalgi forbundet med det.

Draught at Alibi Room, VancouverBlack color with beige head. Smooth mouthfeel and full bodied; although the profile is based on roasted malt, its not too ashy, thank also to a moderate sweetness; the hopping is well present, very resiny, a bit fruity too, as good as it can be in a Black IPA.Excellent.
Pours black. Aroma is roasted malts and chocolate. Taste is bitter with roasted malts followed by a hoppy finish.
22oz bottle. Pours out a dark brown almost black topped with a tan head. Nose is pine roast grapefruit and a nice malty sweetness. Taste is as the nose with lots of hops and dark roast pretty good.
Pour a nice creamy black with a foamy tan head. Big fruity hop aroma, and sine Smokey coffee. Taste is roast malt with some grapefruit hops, and a bitter aftertaste.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a medium sized head of foamy finely sized light brown colored bubbles that were long lasting and left behind a no visible carbonation opaque except at the edges dark black brown colored body. The mild aroma was musty and mild hop. The crisp mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start and at the finish with a mellow hoppy aftertaste. The mild flavor contained notes of bitter black malt mild spice mild hops crisp and hops. A decent one that I would consider drinking again.
20 oz bottle. Pours an extra stout like black, pillowy tan head, some lacing. Big pine and grapefruit aromas. Full oily mouthfeel, bitter coffee, black chocolate, pine, grapefruit all in the taste.

drank this in the dark while watching some dvds. smells of kiwi, and mango with some pencil shavings. i liked the 1st half of the 3. yep, nice hop presence, but the light roast was not something that played well. just a bit vacant to support that kind of hop bite. sweet fruit and tea leaves.a nice contradiction in that it was thick, yet had a thin flavor. ahh, mouthfeel versus flavor. good times. i love a hoppy porer, but i can now say that this india black ale style is not something i will go after again, similar to the sour stouts and porters of a few years back that i had to admit defeat and walk away from, only this style is drinkable with a few pleasant notes.

(Bottle). Pours a deep brown with ample tan head and glass lacing. Mild hop aroma. Mellowed hop flavor balanced by roasted malts. Silky palate. Nicely balanced and well done for the style. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
So malty! Woah! Black ipa.... Or hoppy ass stout. This is a crazy beer that melds styles like nothing Ive ever seen before... Such a good thing.

Poured a lighter black with a huge head. Aroma of malt and lots of hops. Tastes interesting. I get lots of hops with sweet malt and tons of pepper flavor. Not to big on the pepper flavor. This one is ok.
Big bottle. Poured a very dark brown color with a medium sized head. Aroma of hops, caramel, toffee bread. Medium heavy body, creamy texture. Bitter finish. A pretty good BIPA.

Bottle shared by Matt during man night. Aroma of cocoa, some dank, and pine. Pours dusty grey black/brown with a white blanket of head/film. Taste is brownies, bitter resin, and a grassy/roast chocolate finish. Not too extreme in either direction (roast vs. hops) but perfectly gulpable. Not my first choice for a Black IPA.

Aroma is initially very cirus forward hops with a well pronounced roasty, licorice stout-like malt smell. Smells really good. Pours, well, black with a thick cream puff khaki cap. The flavor is actually very calm, creamy and kind of sweet; like a hopped up cream stout. Alcohol is well disguised. Co2 is fairly low. It has a rich, creamy texture. Aroma would lead you to anticipate a harsh bitterness but it is quite tame. Overall very enjoyable. Nice mix of citrus and burnt flavors.

Dark pour with tan head, good lacing. Aromas of grapefruit, sweet cola notes, coffee and ash. Upfront grapefruit that lingers through the finish, some malt sweetness and some roasted bitterness on the finish. Not too bitter from the hops or roasted malts. This is great.
Sample at World of Beer Brewery District 7/19/14. Darkest brown to black pour with a thick tan head. Aroma of oniony hop and some roast. Malty and oniony flavor with a roasty finish.
rich and lightly roasty but not sweet, a thick one, hop bite at the end, this I let sit perhaps for too long, oops
Bomber poured into a tulip glass..dark brown pour with fluffy white head..aroma of hops,citrus,resin..Good bitterness with really good malty backbone..outstanding.

Bomber. Pours a deep brown with a thin head and aromas of orange blossoms, orange peels, coffee grounds and a hint of toffee. Flavor has a very harsh dark malt presence and a nice herbal hops presence that might also demonstrates a bit of resin.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Dark brown pour with tan head. Aroma is grapefruit zest and a touch of breadiness. Flavor is medium dried fruit and a touch of anise. A good citrus bitter with resiny notes as well. Medium bodied with good carbonation.
Black,lasting tan head.Nose of piney hops/light roast.Softly carbonated light piney citrus hop profile. Fruity notes in mid. Needs more roast for style
黒の甘さはな

Happy to try this one. Had to wait for the sun to go down a bit. Pours a very dark brown, bordering into black, nice head. Aroma was loads of citric and slightly piney hops. Flavor matches, with just a faint roasted note running amongst it all. Delightful, reminded me quite a bit of Stones Sublimely Self Righteous. Should try them blind side by side at some point.
On tap. Comes almost black with a decent brown head. Aroma of pine, malt, and citrus. Taste is citrus fruit, pine, malt, chocolate, and coffee. Sounds confusing, but is pretty tasty.

Pours a deep dark color with a light tan head. The first dip sends my palate into a veritable carnival of flavor. Severed on tap in a sifter glass, this beer is to be sipped and appreciated for all that it offers. Very floral. Smooth and relaxing. Citrus notes.. I'm no expert, but let me say.. This is a wonderful beer worthy of one's time.

Tap, dark pour, tan head, nose is coffee, taste is chocolate, overall a good dark ipa.

Growler from Big Hops. Black in the glass. Dark roasted malt and coffee aroma notes. Bright citrus and coco flavors. Overall, very good just not as intense as i was expecting for a black IPA. A bit mild...

Sampled at ESBLS. It poured a black color with a tan head. The aroma was of prunes, raisins, figs, roast, chocolate malt with earthy coffee notes and pine resin hops. The taste was of bitter dark malts, tart fruits, moderate hops and bitterness with a dry finish. Good stuff.

Pours dark with a nice sticky off white foam head that laced my glass. The aroma is of fresh earthy and mild citrus hops, toasted malts, and a semi sweet malty backbone. The flavor is mildly bitter, full in body with sweet and dark malt varieties. It has a nice booziness, a kind bitterness, and a soft dry finish. Overall this was a very good beverage.

I was one or two beers deep, but Ill do my best to remember:

Pours black, off white head. Aroma is malt, perhaps some toasted malt or chocolate, hoppy goodness. Flavor is nicely hoppy for black ale, balanced with the malt very well. A nice, complex, big beer from Lagunitas.

This beer will overpower all other tastes, like superman but its a beer. I really enjoy this beer, not just because it is good. But why is there a dog on the cover and not a girl with a nice set of hooters? I thought this was America

A dark IPA, who knew. From the bottle. Pours very dark brown, good tan head. Smells of pine resin, malt, sweet coffee. Taste is dark chocolate, smokey, hop bitter finish. Perfect nite cap.

delicious dark n hoppy, slight malt excellent finish, another delicious beer from Lagunitas

From the 650 ml. bottle. The pour looks black but it is really more of a very dark brown with a modest, silky beige head. The aroma is incredibly fascinating with its dark toasted malts, earthy and resiny hops, odd dark fruit character, and mild sweetness. The body is medium to full. The taste has an aggressive dark malt and hop flavor. Its a Black ale all the way.

Bomber. Pours a near black, very dark brown color with a dark red hue along the edges. Foamy tan head that leaves quite a bit of lacing around the glass. Pine and resin in the aroma with roasted malt and dark chocolate notes as well. Flavor is nice and bitter with lots of citrus and pine hop flavors. Lingering bitterness in the aftertaste.

Pours black with minimal light tan head. Aroma of cherries, chocolate, light grapefruit. Taste is hoppy with distinct coffee and dark chocolate bitter, lingering bitter finish. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation.

650ml brown bottle. Deep brown with dark red orange highlights peering through. Long lasting light brown foam up top, big bands of lacing in the glass too. Nose has pine and tropical notes. Taste has a bit of chocolate underneath a ton of pine and grapeftuit hops, some lesser tropical notes as well. Finishes with dark chocolate and roasty malts. Good lasting bitterness. Pretty awesome beer.

Draft at brewery. Another black ipa. Ugh. Nose is light coffee with a bit if grassiness and fruit. Taste is a bitter chocolate with some milkiness. Not the worst black ipa but not the best. Ok or above.

Bottle. Pungent pine resin hops aroma with some not so fresh hops notes. Foggy dark mahogany under a lasting off-white blanket. Salty hops flavour with pine and cat pee in front of mild chocolate malt accents. Medium bitterness. Medium body, medium carbonation, dark chocolate very late in the end.

This wonderful black IPA pours a deep black ,off white, tan head. Im getting a nice citrus melon scent . The flavor reminds me of a typical west coast IPA, full of citrus  hops, with a coffee, caramel aftertaste . Very good! Cheers!
Sweet and sour malt aroma. Dark amber color with medium tan head. Short sweet beginning with a moderate alcohol bother middle and finish. Creamy palete.

Bomber. Pours almost black with a heavyish body and really nice reddish hue. Somewhat transparent if you look closely. Light tan head that dissipating but lacing is generous. Hops on the nose dominate aroma with grapefruit, pine, grass, smoke and earth. Taste follows with hops up front and all the right darker beer flavors following- coffee, chocolate, toast, smoke, toffee. Tastes like a dark Lagunitas- familiar and well-loved hop profile. Nicely balanced at the end- long, layered and appropriately bitter finish. Medium bodied, thicker porter-like body and mouthfeel, average lively carbonation. Really solid black IPA- I expect nothing less from these guys.
bottle from capitol beer. pours black with tan head. Nice citrus hop aroma. chocolate roasted malts with citrus hops coming threw at the end. great black IPA

22oz bomber pours with a dark body that supports a nice tall mocha colored head of foam. The aroma offers up thin ribbons of juicy citrus hops as well as modest roasted malt to chocolate malt notes. The taste begins with a pleasing mix of chocolate malts, dark roasted malts and citrus hop goodness that has thin hop flavor notes but grows into a formidable degree of bitter nearly resiny hoppiness. This heads into the finish with citrusy hop bitterness, chocolate and deeply roasted malts and it all fits together wonderfully. Solid Black IPA.

Bomber. Pours a very dark brown with a light tan two finger head that leaves plenty of lacing. Hop dominate aroma with grapefruit, pine and grass with a bit of smoky dark malts in the background. Taste is also hops up front with the earthy hops being slightly more dominant than the citrus hops. However both come through in spades. Roasty chocolate and caramel malts with a bit of toasted bread coming in behind the hops. Long, pronounced, somewhat bitter finish of earthy and citrusy hops and toasted dark malts. Medium bodied, thicker porter-like texture and mouthfeel, average lively carbonation. This is a black IPA done right! One of the best Ive had.

Draught at SB. Pours a near-black color with a very small head on it. Nose is slightly roasty, but it hop dominant, with some really nice citrus and grapefruit notes coming through. Taste is very bitter and just a little bit fruity, with only slight amounts of roasting coming through. Quite nice...

Bottle. Pours near black with a chocolate brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma is musty dark grains with light roast and an earthy pine. Taste is slightly bitter from the roast and hops. Finishes with a slight chocolate light roast malt note. This is a nice Black IPA

Pours a dark brown black with super thick head. Aroma Is citrucy piney Hops with roasted Smokey malts. Taste follows The aroma Well. Tasty beer not very complex but strong in both hops and roasted malt characters. Yummy!

Almost black beer with a thin, off-white head. Strong hop aroma with some coffee roast. Tastes of herbal/spruce hops, some biscuit malt, and dark coffee flavors. Bitter coffee/hop finish. This was pretty good. Hoppier than I expected without much balance.

Appearance: stoutlike, with an active, creamy light tan head and generous lacing.  Aroma: 	lightly sweet citrus and floral notes over a bit of roast espresso and toasted brown bread.  Taste: sweet caramel and light chocolate, with grapefruit, orange, marmalade, vanilla, with some piney, resinous hops as well. Finish: soft palate, creamy, with a bit of lasting roasty bitterness and citric acidity. Notes: Great example of the style. Good palate, balanced flavors, alcohol extremely well-hidden.
UPDATED: JUL 24, 2014 Floral and pine hops. Nutty caramel and malts balance the hop bitterness. A bit grassy but smooth.

Bottle. Pours near black with a chalky brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has lots of musty dark grains with light roast and an earthy pine backbone. Flavor begins with a pine and dark grain combination and finishes with a bit of roasted malt.

Aroma is really dank/grassy hops with a hint of dark malts. The flavor is dank hops, dark malts, mild sweetness and a bitter/dryish finish. I paid either 5 or 6 dollars for a bomber of this, the best bang for the buck as far as beer I have ever bought.

22 FL OZ ($4.99) WOW! Lagunitas hit the season right on the head wit hthis power house. Not sure if this is going to be this good throughout the season or if its so good as its part of the first wave of release. tastes close to what youd consider a tap pour. very hoppy IPA with enough bitter to satisfy and feels like a 1/5 mix of a black beer was added into it. I suggest all guys who like a strong beer to try this out, not common is a 8.2% ABV only $4.99.

This was recommended to me by a friend and I am very glad that he mentioned it! A blackened brown fills the glass and a very unsubstantial but determined burnt umber head tops it off. The lacing is thin but consistent, and trails gracefully over the glass. A medium body and a comfortable level of carbonation and deliver a nice hops, (heady) toasty malts, light fruits, and a resinous pine that infiltrate my senses and make me very happy. :-)

This isnt my favorite black rye, but I will say that it has definitely been added to my list of go-tos!

Happy to try another dark IPA. My current favorite style. This one holds up very well, true to the style in appearance, aroma and taste. This is now my second favorite black IPA.

22oz bottle shared up north on Lake Itasca. Dark black pour with a thick light brown head. Nose is spicy hops and pine tree resin. Nice mouthfeel and carbonation. Some good hop kick to this - less resin in the taste than the nose. Lightly bitter finish.
a black IPA; dark brown-black color; citrusy hop and roasted malt aroma; a dark, hoppy beer; roasted malt base with a good deal of hops and citrusy notes; dry, bitter finish

650 ml bottle. Pours almost black with moderate head. Aromas of vegetables, kelp, pine, and sour candy. Flavours are similar and stronger with cola and tobacco. Interesting but bizarre. Really just a Northwest hops extract.

Bottle to glass. Pours a deep brown almost black color with a medium brown head. Aroma is packed full of fresh wet hop character, with mild citrus, fleshy fruits, and a subtle toasty malts. Flavor is a well balanced toasty malt sweetness with piney fleshy fruit hops. Light to medium in body with a lingering toasted fruity goodness. Exactly what I want in a black IPA. Well done. And thanks for always being cheap lagunitas!
Very nice beer. Pours cola brown with aroma of citrus, toasted malt. and coffee. Fruit flavor with toasted malt, pine, hops, and chocolate.

This one poured a darker brown with a beige head. Aroma of fresh citric and tropical hops and only light roast. Flavor was similar, hardly Amy sign of roasted malt aside from the color. This is what a black ipa should taste Pike.

Had this draft beer during the 7/4 beer tour 2014 at Hollywood Gardens/Brixton. Sweet aroma, dark brew. Thin head. Very little co2. Not as alky as I was expecting. Nice lacing. taste is a little medicinal near the finish. Yes, does not seem like 8%. Flat. Does not really have many IPA attributes like many other black ipa.

text: Bomber into a snifter. Pour is onyx with a thin but lacy khaki head. Aroma is a touch of chocolate with a fair amount of coffee. Resiny hops with some pine and citrus, pineapple comes through. Taste is bitter malt dark chocolate, faint coffee and a bitter hop profile. A nice kind of orange chocolate finish with lingering hop bitterness and pine in between sips. Nice stuff.

Pour appears similar brown to cola with few inches of similar cocoa/chaki head, notable lacing as well. Nose is big, lots of bright citrus, some feathery florals, pungent rye. Soft carbonation, mouthfeel is a perfect thickness, clean finish. Taste is assertive and great but light for the ABV. Piney hops and citrus zest flavors, some tangerine, pollen too. Malt influence is definitely in the background and primarily the color but bitter rye and biscuit are evident. Good hoppy black IPA with little malt presence.

Its like someone put fresh cut grass in a cup of coffee. Bottle to chalice. Muddy brown to dark chocolate with off white head and good lacing. Big green grass hop aroma up front. Notes of chocolate on the back end. Taste has a lot of hops with bits of dark malts finished with dry grass. The beer goes hops, malt, hops, malts. Great example of a black IPA, tastes more like an IPA than a stout. Another solid beer from Lagunitas.
A really nice beer. Very hoppy nose and good hops flavor but not only bitter. Nice toasted notes on the flavor. Good stuff.
Bottle. Dark brown pour, with a light tan head. Roasted malt, pine, hop bitterness, some bittersweet chocolate, and grapefruit.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2014 Bottle - big thick head, almost black color with a little amber around the edges, wonderful grapefruit hop aroma and flavor, perfect very mild roasted malt balance, excellent overall - became even better as you keep drinking it too

Tap at Muddy Waters. Deep black color and the roasted malt aroma you want from a black ale. Taste has great sweet elements with the good hop balance the Lagunitas Brewery typically delivers. Lacing is beautiful. The roasted malt comes through without overwhelming the rest of the flavors. A good one.

bottle - Pours near black with a light tan head. It has a piney hop aroma with a trace of roast malt. The flavor is similar with the hops dominating and a good pine character to go with surprisingly subdued roast malt. Medium bodied. Quite tasty.

Best black IPA/CDA Ive tried to date. Wonderfully smooth and rich, velvety mouth feel, sweet and bitter on the finish. Oily black body with small beige head, mild hops aroma, hops and roast grains blend perfectly in the taste. Yummy!
Growler. Black in color with small beige head. Citrusy hoppy aroma. Very hop-forward flavor, mellow and citrusy. Some roastiness follows in the finish. Well done.

Bottled: unk

Its black, got a robust tan head. Smells roasty, resiny, some leather, some pine. Flavor is toasted and has a good amount of chocolates, coffee, bitterness, some brutal weed flavors - I feel like this is supposed to be a bong water beer. Medium bodied with a reserved carb. Well, meh.

Bottle. Pours black with tan head. Aroma is crazy hoppy, very piney, a touch of roast but mostly just a hop bomb. Taste is very hoppy but a really nice crisp malt flavor to balance. The beer is really good! A damn good deal too.

Pour is nearly black, ruby around the edges, with moderate, soapy lace - nose is a nicely incorporated mixture of bittersweet and roasty black malts and tangy, green hoppiness - soft carbonation, creamy texture - flavor is similar to the aroma - bittersweet dark malts, with touches of roast and smoke - tangy, medium bitter hops are mildly citric and woody - the alcohol does not become apparent until the finish, where is it just mildly warming - pretty solid black IPA.

Cola pour with brownish-tan head. Can smell it right away after opening the bottle. Dank pine with grapefruit and light tropical fruit. Flavor is pine and citrus bitterness finishing with cocoa/faint roast and mild brown sugar. Lingering pine and citrus. Lightly dry.

Pours almost black, thick creamy head, nice lacing. Aroma big dank floral and tropical hops, slight bready malt, very faint roast, classic Lagunitas. Taste bitter, resinous, dank floral, tropical, tangerine, enough sweet malt to keep bitterness in check. Mouthfeel medium body and carbonation, spicy, dry finish. Overall great beer, best black ipa Ive had, Lagunitas got it right as they usually do! The price point is the icing on the cake, couldnt find a better value.

From a very reasonably prices bomber into an English pint glass. Pours a reasonably dark brown with some thick ass white head. Great hoppy and grassy aroma. Mouthfeel is great with
Perfect carb. Taste is mint chalk hops roast and yummyness. Very solid black ipa. Restrained bit in a good balanced way.

Draft at HopCat GR - pours a murky brown with tan head . Huge citrus nose . Taste is lots of juicy citrus blended with resiny pine and a hint of smoke . Outstanding brew!!!

Very nice pour to this brew from a bomber, dark brown bodied with a tall, dense pale brown head. I know it will take a while for the aroma to seep through. bomber, Black pour with a thick off-white head. Great lacing. Aroma is citrus and pine malts. Tastes of cereal, coffee, rye, spices, definitely well balanced. Some roasted malt and hoppy feeling. Great brew!!
Bottle. Nice chocolate and citrus nose. Oranges, some pine and licorice. flavor is chocolate, pine and licorice, no roast. Very smooth, nice bitterness. Good stuff.

Distinctive bomber, OK label. Dark Jacobean stain colored brew, persistent light tan head. Complex but unappealing, pungent hoppy aroma - notes of kat whiz, body odor, acidic roast, lightly sweet, pineapple. Pineapple notes on top of a chili-like savoriness. Medium body - plays on the heavy side - good carbonation. Finishes out with echoes of all the flavor profile. Strange brew. ABC, Betton.

Bottle from Hazels beverage world. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with licorice, anis, hops, coffee, roasted malts and nuts. Bitter finish with hops, licorice, anis and roasted malts. Excellent black IPA.

Bomber from Giant Eagle on High. Blackish pour with a huge off-white head and strong retention. Aroma is resiny citrus and pine. Tastes are cereal, coffee, rye, spice dark fruit - well balanced. Roasted malt and tropical fruit background. Very nice.
Bottle. Aroma is a nice citrus hoppy. Light bitter taste on a medium body, a little nutty, amber ale. Very delicious and sessionable ale.
Very nice. Initial flavor is all ipa with a note of coffee and chocolate that blossoms nicely through the finish. Well balanced.

22oz bottle pours a watery, mahogany brown with a lot of creamy, off white head. Nose is a solid balance, malty, bread crust, crackery, soap, some pine, a little dried orange peel. Flavor is piney, dry cracker, malt, a little licorice, some spicy rye, soap. Medium bodied, bitter, dry finish.

Poured from a 22 oz. bottle into a snifter. Pours a dark cloudy brown/black with an inch thick tan foamy head. Smells of pine, resin, and tropical fruits. Small presence of coffee and chocolate, with the major focus on the hop characteristics. Medium bodied beer with medium carbonation. Small lingering bitterness and a dry finish. Nicely done
Coffee black with frothy tan head. Big hop smell with light coal undertones. Hop Ipa bitter front washed by a bitter coal finish.

22oz bottle. Medium tan head atop cola dark brown body. Aroma is moderately sweet, pine/grapefruit, some pineapple, caramel. Taste is moderately sweet, pineapple/grapefruit, some caramel, light chocolate. Medium-full body, light resin, stickiness.

Bottle at home. Pours clear black with a medium, creamy and rocky beige head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is prunes, raisins and figs, roast and chocolate malt with earthy coffee notes and pine, resin hops. Flavor is bitter dark malt, lightly tart dark fruits, medium to moderate hops and bitterness with a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

$4.49 bomber from Safeway Salinas. Nose is heavy with flowery hops, light pine, and some light nutty and roasted notes. Black with brown edges and a medium, lightly lacing beige head. Flavor is bitter and piney with some background nuttiness. Another great, inexpensive offering from the Lagunitas guys!

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2015 Aroma is earthy, lemon grass and slight roasted malts. Taste is sweet malts that are quickly replaced by a fairly powerful hop body that lingers until finish. Some tartiness and earthiness on finish. Body is black with a head that retains fairly well.

22oz bottle. Pours near black with an off white head that thins. Aroma has juicy notes of tropical fruit, citrus, pine, and a touch of resin. Taste is a bit bitter with citrus, pine, resin, and a touch of roast. Dry finish. Medium-full body with a medium carbonation. Smooth texture with a slight alcohol taste and warmth. Overall a nice, juicy brew with lots of pine, resin, tropical fruit, and a touch of roast.
Well done. Pours deep brown with a tan head. Aroma is nutty and piney hops. Very smooth, balanced finish.

Bottle. Tasty, citrus notes very easy to drink. Good malt base, frothy head.

text:
22 oz. bottle purchased at On The Vine. Deep dark brown, black in the center. Lasting tan head leaves spider web lacing down the glass. Aroma is layers of chocolate malt, citrus, pine and earth. Hints of leafy green hops are here as well as the flavor. 
Rich deep layers of dark malts and citrus and pine hop gives roasted grain, charred coffee bean, pine cone and light orange or grapefruit citrus. Hints of dank leafy hops. Citrus bitterness lingers for a good while after the sip and helps cut all the roasted grain and chocolate malt. Mouthfeel is creamy with the body leaning on full. Almost a stout like body. For me this is everything I like about the style, and the hearty mouthfeel is a turn on. Well crafted and this is a repeat buy for me.
Lagunitas is killing it. Rich, chocolate malt, some wood, some pit fruit, some great unique phenols.

Bomber: Aroma has got a nice hop note upfront, grapefruit, citrus, and not much of a malt note at all. Appearance is a black pout with a thick off white head that lingers for quite a while. Taste has got a nice upfront hop not with a real subtle malt not in the backing. Palate is medium carbonation with a light hop aftertaste. Overall, Decent but nothing special. Cheers!

Grapefuit nose. Mahogany, thick tan head, good retention and lacing. Soil, cola and cocoa, with a bright grapefruit accent. Woody from beginning to end. Medium body. Good bitterness. Similar to SSSR, not quite as sharp, but very delicious.
22 oz bomber pours black with a tan head. Aroma of citrus, pine, roasted malts and spice. Taste is resin and malts.

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co., and shaker served, with a black/brown hue, a lingering layer of moussy, tan head foam, and sheet-like cling to the lacing. The nose was sweetened citrus as orange & grapefruit, with secondary scents of roast, and pine. The taste was robust bitterness that boasted earthy & citrusy astringency, but was calmed a bit by some malt sweetness, and alcohol warmth. Medium bodied, with decent effervescence, and presentable drinkability for a higher abv brew.

Bomber. Pours a deep brown with a sustaining light tan cap. Aroma of earth, slightly spoiled citrus, pine, charred chocolate. Taste is mostly bitter with a bit of sweetness. Sticky and looooong dry finish.

Poured very dark brown, almost pitch black color with three fingers of khaki tan frothy head. Healthy amount of thick layered foamy lacing along the sides of the glass. Great retention on the top all the way down. 

Smelled a decent whiff of hops up front, surprisingly. Citrus hops, grapefruit rind, tangerine and floral hops. That gave way to dark chocolate, cocoa, cocoa nibs and some roasty malts. The hops really dominate here though.

Tasted pretty good, but not quite as nice as the smell. Not as hoppy either, but still a rather bitter finish. Sharp citrus hops, tangerine, orange rind and some floral hops. Also tropical hops, mainly mango and pineapple. Light roasty chocolate. 

Medium body. Creamy texture. Lively carbonation. Long, bitter finish.

Really surprised at how much I liked this one. A lot hoppier than I thought, but that was the best part. Would definitely have it again.

22oz bottle 6/27/14 (Binnys Naperville)-42° in Shaker-Pours black with a loose small tan head. Aroma of hops and roasted malt. Taste of hops, malt, and slight chocolate. This medium bodied brew is well balanced and is darn tasty.

Bomber. This pours black and has a big rich thick creamy beige head. I smell dark malts and grain with some lactic notes. First sip brings the dark malts and earth. A bit of cocoa emerges. So far I have gotten very light IPA notes. Minimal fruit and even less bitterness. However, mid bottle citrus is tasted and it is tropical and grapefruit. The finish brought that fruit and then something minty. This was tasty and also interesting and unique.

Opaque, very tall and persistent head, dense lace. 
Full body, moderate flavor intensity, smooth texture but lacking some alcohol or carbonation kick, long palate. 
Bitter but far from dry, just enough acidity, all balanced. 
Roast and floral flavors.

Pours very dark brown with a large tan head. The aroma has lots of tropical fruits (pineapple heavy), somewhat sweet citrus and mild malt - I dont get any roastiness. It has a smooth medium / thick body with mild semi-soft carbonation. The flavor begins with grapefruit, bit sweet mild roast, pine and crackers. The finish dries out a lot with rough resiny hops. Really good black IPA.

The style heavily limits my enjoyment of this beer, but its got a nice piny aroma reminiscent of being in an evergreen forest and a slight almost minty quality. Im still not a fan of black IPAs but this is a good one.

Pours deep brown into a shaker. Off-white head with little retention recedes to hug rim. Resin and chocolate aromas. Soft with dark chocolate and resin upfront turning hot in the lasting earthy espresso finish.
22 oz bottle. Pours really dark with a hoppy aroma. Really nice balance here of hoppiness and dark roasted malt flavor. Very nice, easy drinking beer. Long toasty finish. Flavorful. Good stuff.

Draught @ Brouwers Café: &nbsp Deep cola in color, nice sandy head and lacing. &nbsp Moderate hop aroma, soft roastiness. &nbsp Was told this was better than Wookey Jack. &nbsp So far its a bit hoppier, but not as smooth. &nbsp Nice hop background, fairly assertive, with a clean strong roasted malt presence. &nbsp Smooth, very smooth. &nbsp Moderate body and mouthfeel. &nbsp Okay, so maybe its still smooth without being as rich as Wookey. &nbsp Its a big IPA with a nice roastiness, decent body and at a great price point. &nbsp For a Black IPA, its hard to beat this one. &nbsp A great solid example!

Bottle: Black like the nighttime (whoa) with no light penetrating the edges; chunky, long lasting, burnt khaki foam on top, lots of gorgeous lacing left behind. Aroma is a little more hop than malt for this iteration, some spicy pine notes, herbal white pepper, mild ash, & a light grapefruit peel essence. A touch of roast & burnt caramel sweetness from the obviously dark malt backbone. Taste is balanced more evenly with pine, grapefruit rind, & evergreen notes over the top with roast, burnt caramel, & creamy chocolate malt underneath. Some milky sweetness & cocoa fades into a bitter pine & herbaceous, ashy hop finish. Nice & creamy mouth feel, too; unexpected, I guess, but it works nicely. A really nice black IPA, I was surprised by how much I enjoyed this one.

Draft at bistro on bridge. Pours black with a beautiful brown head, good retention. The aroma has huge pine, citrus, light pine, a touch of roast. The taste has a light bitterness, some grapefruit, a touch of roasted coffee. Excellent.

Deep very dark brown coloured body with a black glow and a very thin tan head. Aroma of pungent PNW hops with a big pine and resin flavour and quite a bit of roasted malt noticeable along with a light grassy note. Medium-bodied; Assertive hops up front with a large roasted malt flavour with coffee and bitter nuts all noticeable, but the finish is an undeniable hop flavour that persists even through all the malt. Aftertaste is very nice with a great balance between the hops and the roasted malt, but the alcohol hardly shows through despite its large presence. Overall, a great Black IPA - perhaps one of the best Ive ever had and definitely worth trying if you can find this! I sampled this 65 cL bottle purchased from Costco (yes, they have a bomber section at my local Costco!) for US$4.99 on 11-June-2014 sampled at home in New Paltz, New York on 13-June-2014.

Bomber. Nose of chocolate and black malt, some roast and strongly spicy hops, but this aroma is somewhat more malt-focused. Pours straight pitch with a dense and creamy tan head. Taste is sugary-sweet but not over-the-top, medium body is very creamy and simple, theres some gentle roast and smooth malted-milk style creaminess, faint citric and stronger spicy components from the hops. Light resin and dough, bitterness ends up grading low, but theres enough to provide some measure of balance. On the whole, thats a good word, balance, and there are no missteps here -- clean, bigger than suggested, all elements carrying weight. Yum.

Pours a dark black with thick white head. Has a strong floral hop aroma you expect with Lagunitas, with citrus and pine. Taste is mostly of citrus/floral hops, that then has strong flavor of malt and light coffee. A lingering bitter taste that is slightly sour with the mix between hops and coffee.
This would be perfect with a little more backbone. It has a great fresh hop flavor balanced with a nice finish. Great beer.

22 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured dark brown, nice thick foamy tan head and lots of lacing on the glass. Aroma of hops (citrus, pine) and some roasted malts. Taste: this beer is delicious, nice bitter hoppiness, very well balanced with some roasted malt sweetness for a smooth finish. Very enjoyable.
On tap at Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours dark brown with a thick tan head and a citrus and treacle aroma. There is a rich chocolate and dark molasses flavor with a bitter hoppy finish.

Dark brown pour, decent carbonation. Citric and light citrus aromas supported by some pine and resin, roasted malts. Big bitter hop blast on the tongue, citrus and pine come forth, roasted malt bitterness in the finish. Very good BIPA.

Pours a dark brown with a decent light tan head. Aroma is hop cones. Taste is semi-sweet roasted malt, coffee, celery and a medium hop bitterness. Interesting brew and the cheapest bomber on the shelf at $3.99!.

Bottle: murky brown pond water look with a small off-white head. Piney and toasted hop aroma with a alcohol and hops in the taste. The most unique thing about this beer is its incredibly thick body. Its like drinking tomato soup. Most impressive for kicking all of the other black IPAs in the crotch. I also enjoyed it after 2am which made the name appropriate.
Bottle. Pine resin and grapefruit hops with milk chocolate malt. Medium sweetness, high bitterness, soft body, bouncy carbonation, luscious malt.
Nice complex head. Dark dark. Tastes like something out of a roadside tavern in the middle ages. But good.. Nice woody lightly burnt malt n aromatic hops.

$4.49 bomber at Trader Joes. Pours with a big smell of dried hops. Black thick body with a slightly off-white head, though a bit more ocher to the pouring part. Nose when Im drinking is strong on Amarillos or Citras. A fruity ale background builds on some grapefruit hop character. A bit grainy, with warming alcohol along the background. Great value.

Pretty meaty, earthy brew with some huge guns. A walloping eight-plus abv, and a complexity that rolls up its sleeves. And check the ridiculously great nose. A perfect beginning or ending to your night.

Bomber from Monterey Trader Joes for $3.99. Dark brown pour with a long lasting light creamy brown head. Nice strong aroma of grapefruit, peach, mango and papaya. Flavor is of medium to strong intensity and includes tangerine, lemon, some sugary sweetness, light roasted malts and a pithy bitterness. Level of carbonation is high for an IPA and is fine and prickly on the tongue. The body is fairly light. Overall the beer is very good and the price is even better.

Bottle. Pours out an almost black with a small off white head. Aroma is of nice juicy citrus hops, mild sweet caramel, light chocolate and some toast. Taste is smooth, yet complex, nice punch of juicy dank citrus hops, followed bt some tasted malt, light chocolate, coffee grounds, and then more piney/citrusy hops. Tasty

Tallahassee, Fl - Quick N Save - 22 oz bomber. Pours a deep rich dark brown with a sticky mocha colored head that leaves plenty of lacing. Rich aroma with plenty of rye minty goodness and spruce tips. Full-bodied flavor with some citrus bitterness, black licorice, some rye mintiness, a nice dollop of bakers unsweetened chocolate and some black coffee. thick rich mouthfeel. Lagunitas delivers again for a fair price - $5.99.

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2014 Reddish brown pour. Nice head and lacing. Malty aroma with raisan/ plum and some spice. Taste is raisan, plum, pepper and some hops at end. Very balanced and smooth. Good black ipa.

Pours a very dark amber with off white head that leaves heavy lacing. Aromas of currant, malt, and a little spice. Malty flavor with notes of raisin, a little spice, some hidden hops and coffee with malty overtones from start to finish. Pretty good black ipa.

Pours a deep brown with a large tan head that lasts forever. Aromas of medium roast, citrus fruit. Taste is semi dry, bitter, slightly spicy. Flavors if roasted coffee mixed with a great tropical hop expression. Nice. Finishes bitter, roasty and semi-chewy. This is a great beer.

Cocoa roast, and citrus, floral hops. Aroma has the "Black IPA" herbal-ish character; so does the flavor, but quite a but less. Also some sweet malt flavor, and cereal in the finish. Some raisin-like flavor.

Starts off with a dank and pine hop aroma, with a roasted undertone. Pours an almost opaque black, with a huge tan head. Roasted flavors pair nicely with the hop bitterness, leaving a long lingering bitter finish. Slightly slick mouthfeel, and very well hidden alcohol. This is a really fantastic beer, especially at the price point ($4 a bomber).
Dark brown pour with a pillowy tan head. Aroma consists of citrus and piney hops. Taste of dark roasted malt with pine and citrus, chocolate and ash. Very smooth in texture. Pretty decent overall.

Pours a deep black with a frothy tan head that leaves sticky, thick ring lacing. The nose is tropical and grassy, of grapefruit, pineapple, orange and pine sap. Flavors are of heavy juicy citrus fruits, pine needles, light roasts, some smoke, a decent grain bill, and a nicely hopped back palate. The mouthfeel is smooth, with easy carbonation, medium to medium-full bodied, and the latent dry-hopping provides a nice activity to the palate. This is a very decent Black IPA, and another reason to really like Lagunitas for caring about their "Limited Release" series.

Aroma hits you quickly...u can smell it from a distance. Which is very fine in my eyes. Very lagunitas when it comes to the aroma and taste. This lacks in the roasted malt character I like in my black iPas... It's real good though...mmmmmmm and like a $4.00 bomber. The every mans beer company. Thanks!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. 

A: Thick black body with a big fluffy cappuccino head. 

N: Gigantic hop aroma. Pineapple, grapefruit, pine, earth, toffee, and some orange syrup. A touch of cocoa and coffee and roast, but that could also originate from my mind translating the color to taste. (Not in a synesthetic way.) 

T: Softly bitter with a touch of malt. 

M: Resinous, pillowy, medium bodied.

O: Without looking at this, one would think its a deep golden DIPA. The stout nature of something like Wookey Jack falls by the wayside. The dark malt adds an element of roast, certainly, but this is definitely closer to IPA land (and Lagunitas Sucks) than hoppy stout.

Very dark pour with a creamy, tan head. The aroma is very earthy and grassy with a toasted malt touch. It has a medium body with creamy texture and soft carbonation. The taste is mildly bitter with a smooth, slightly roasted finish.

Good looking black IPA with a deep mahogany color and an airy, lasting tan head. Taste is very slightly malty, with strong notes of pine and citrus. Crisp mouthfeel with a pleasant dry finish.

Kevin did well to select this one for me for Dads day on some quality advice from Dan. I always like a Lagunitas product and especially one I have not sampled. Very dark with a really interesting frothy retention/lacing pattern. Nose is a mix of chocolate malt and citrus. Taste is a bit acidic at 1st, then a bit of chocolate, and powdered cocoa, then a bit of dry piney hops. Quite drinkable

Bomber out of a brown bag on the metra, so I cant really comment on the appearance, so lets just assume its dark and sexy like a black IPA should be. Taste is a nice blend if citrus and pine. Has that dark rye taste that black IPAs usually have but not as over the top as some. Overall this is quite an enjoyable double black IPA. Easy drinking with a nice hoppy punch. Best of all, this bomber cost $4.39.

22 oz bottle. Another Black IPA, what am i thinking? Dark brown with a foamy beige cap. Nose is orange juice, cocoa, grass and funky cat. Oily medium body with brisk carb. Taste is pine needles, coffee bean, unsweetened chocolate and grapefruit peel. Earthy finish, and of course its bitter.
Bottle.deep black color with a dryer taste.. Malt and hop balance. Not as boozy tasting as expected . Decent

Pours a black color that only has the slightest ruby highlights when held to a light. Tan head that lasts the whole beer with lots of lacing. Hoppy aroma with a roasty malt balance. Lots of pine hop flavor. Much lighter mouth feel than you expect from its appearance.

En fût au Riverside Market. Un liquide brun foncé sur lequel flotte une mousse qui laisse de longues traces. Le nez est bien touffu en conifères et en pamplemousses avec une touche de malts bruns et noirs qui font soupirer dautres fruits tropicaux. Très intéressant mais pas explosif ni renversant. Au goût, des agrumes et des arbres verts qui grimpent sur mes papilles pour ne jamais les lâcher. Les malts arrondissent le tout avec du chocolat et des notes rôties. Encore une fois, agréables saveurs qui ne me font pas basculer dans la zone du merveilleux. En bouche, jai la sensation dun liquide crémeux comme peut lêtre une bonne crème à 35% de matière grasse. En finale, cest amer mais aussi un peu suret, parfumée, il va sans dire, mais aussi étrange sans être nécessairement inquiétant. Une IPA noire très intéressante qui termine cependant deuxième derrière la Keegans de Cigar City.

Bottle @ Chads house. Pours a deep brown appearance with a lasting creamy brown head. Creamy chocolate, lightly roasted, minty, somewhat dank, slightly meaty nose. Soft mouth feel. Flavor is also a bit meaty. Burnt chocolate, piney / herbal / grassy hoppy flavor. Drinks pretty good but not transcendental like some have suggested.
This ranks right up there with Stones Sublimely Selfrighteous. Big citrus hops with great roasted malt character.
22 oz bottle pours a dark black color with an off white head. Aromas of citrus, pine, and dark roasted malt. Full bodied, nicely done black ipa
A solid black IPA. Has the dark brown appearance and medium body youd expect with a goodly amount of bittering and flavor hops. Sharp pine.

Bomber. Pours dark reddish brown with a fluffy marshmallow tan head. Loads of sticky lacing. Aroma of tropical fruits, resin, and roasted malts. Taste is of roasted malts, resin, tropical fruits, and a hint of cocoa. Pretty tasty. Medium body. Nice light bitterness on the finish

22 oz. bottle from SoHo Organic Market, Elizabeth City, NC. Brown cola-like pour with a frothy tan head. Aroma of simcoe hops, grapefruit, and hints of dark chocolate. The taste is a nearly perfect blend of citrus hop bitterness upfront, dark chocolate and coffee that lingers on the palate, and an overall balance of contrasting flavors. Very well done!

10oz pour into snifter. I will preface this with black IPAs are not my favorite. Pours a dark brown with a disappearing tan head. Nose is very grassy, slight coffee, finished with a strong resinous dank aroma. Taste follow similar profile. Thin mouth feel with low carbonation, medium hops, Snd thin to medium body.
Delicious flavor. Pour is a nice dark black with a thin brown head. Flavor is heavy black.
Black, as one might expect. Smells like piney coffee. Taste is coffee, red wine, and piney hops. Some grapefruit, as well. Fairly crisp finish.

Dark dark brown opaque pour with medium off white head. Aroma is very lagunitas like. Grapefruit and tropical fruit hop aroma. Little to no malt roastiness. Flavor very well balanced. Mango, grapefruit hops most pronounced, but some coffee roast comes through slightly.
