22 oz bomber from Winco mega grocery store in S.Salem of all places.
$3.49
Pours a murky ,turbid mahogany colour with a great thick, frothy sea foam head that is light tan in colour.
loads of spicy, citric and resinous hop aromas. This has to one of the hoppiest aromas from a BIPA I have had!Getting a small amount of nuttiness also. Nice.
The taste is more balanced with a semi-sweet coffee mellowing out the hops and a great liquorice after taste.
Great mouth feel..thick and smooth yet very drinkable and no sign of the alcohol strength.
Very nice BIPA but very dangerous as this drinks like something 5% alc.

Bomber from Capones. Pours hazy dark brownish black with 3-finger khaki head. Nose is roasty dark malt, walnut, cacao, hops, pine nuts. Tastes extremely hpoppy, with resiny and piney notes, dark malt, and mild finishing nuts. The IBUs must approach 3 figs in this, and it finishes complex. This is a hell of an intense beer, and delicious, and maybe the best black IPA Ive yet had. This one will make you have wet dreams in your nightmares.

Tap at hoppy monk
pours black witb a small lite tan head and good ring lacing. Nose is woody slight copper penny and piney hops. Flavors are very woody piney yet subtle for the abv. Lots of char in tbis one. Very balanced actually which is good but I was expecting a more robust hop profile. Long woody lightly spicy roasty and piney finish. Very long finish. Body is lush and soft. Very solid black ipa!
Very nice black IPA. Although not the best in this style -- would like to see more roasty malts -- its nevertheless exceptional. A good dosage of hops, with a solid malt underbelly.

22 oz bomber. Pours a very dark brown with some tan head. The aroma is typical Lagunitas and reminds me of a hybrid between Sucks and Maximus with strong pine and citrus notes and the only difference being the very subtle roasted malt present. Taste follows the nose and although there is some malt and roastiness present this beer is dominated by hops. Medium to full bodied and creamy. Another solid beer from Lagunitas.

Pours a beautiful dark chocolate with light tan head. Aroma of vanilla, nutmeg and hops. Taste is smooth. Starts with the hops and that blends with a bit of hazelnut. Flavors not too strong and I admit I was expecting more. Solid beer.

Pour is a dark brown with a large tan head. Aroma is an eye opening pine hop. Flavor is again is well hopped with some of the chocolate malts coming through. Finish is a hoppy resin with a decent roast and chocolate malt. This is definitely the hoppiest black IPA Ive ever had. The hops are well pronounced and the coffee and chocolate are much more subdued here but thats only to make way for those fresh hops. To top all that off it only cost 4 bucks a bomber.
Clear brown pour with ring of khaki layer of head. Fantastic earthy foresty citrusy hop. Id call it a "brown ipa". Smooth and semi-velvety body. Very nice indeed

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2015 Whoa this is wicked right from the prying of the cap. Cold citrus nose, lime, papaya, soft cocoa, canned peach juice, faint roast, melon - cool aromas and none of that typical crappy coffee/heavy roast nose. Taste follows sit with the addition of a huge bitter blast. Massive bitter savaging tied into sharp citrus and a tangy weird roasty thing as a base. All sips are equally excellent. Man, I love Lagunitas beers. Hop happy heaven. Its just endless.

Poured from bottle into a pint glass 
Appearance  The beer pours a dark brown nearly black color with a one finger head of a tan colored foam. The head has a good level of retention, fading slowly over time to leave a great level of foamy lace on the sides of the glass
Smell  The aroma of the beer is heaviest of hoppy smells with lots of pine and a decent showing of some grapefruit and earthy smells. Along with these aromas are some roasted malt aromas as well as some chocolate smells with other sweeter aromas of a rather strong caramel and a lighter tangerine and pineapple aroma. Overall rather inviting.
Taste  The taste begins with an odd blend of a bready and lightly roasted flavor with some caramel and lighter fruit flavors. Some light grapefruit hop flavors and a little bit of a chocolate flavor is also present upfront, but these two flavors are quite light. Actually, overall the flavor is rather bland upfront with it being relatively light for a beer of 8.2 %. It does intensify in roast, hop, and chocolate as the flavor advances though with the light fruit flavors that were present upfront fading from the taste. The hop flavors intensify by the coming of some lighter pine and grassy flavors coming to the tongue and with a slight increase in the grapefruit. These transitions do help the flavor overall, but even so, the hop and roasted flavors are a little bit lighter then would have been anticipated, leaving a mid-range hoppy and dark taste to linger on the tongue.
Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on average side in terms of its thickness and creaminess with a carbonation level that is a little on the lower side. The lower carbonation is quite nice for accentuating the somewhat lighter hoppy and roasted flavors, enhancing them overall, but a slightly thicker body would have done an even nicer job of this, leaving the beer with just a slightly above average feel overall.
Overall  The brew looks and smells fantastic, but the beginning of the taste and the mouthfeel were kind of off at times. A decent brew, but really not all that outstanding overall.

Draft at Beer Culture with Paul. Pours a black body with superbly thick head and lacing. Aroma is fresh grass, tropical fruit and melon. Also, some very subtle smoked meat - not really any roasted character thats typically found in a black IPA - more so just very faint woody meat flavor. Mouthfeel is creamy and silky with notes of peach, bitter grapefruit hop, grass and the tropical fruits again. The roast comes through a touch in the finish accompanied by some chocolate and faint alcohol. A really solid offering from Lagunitas.

22 oz. bomber pours an opaque dark brown with lasting tan head and good lacing. Aroma is full of pine resin and roasted malts, with a hint of chocolate. Taste is mostly with just enough malty sweetness in the middle before a big piney finish and some alcohol kick in. Body is medium to full with average carbonation and a sticky mouthfeel. This is the strongest black IPA Ive tried. Lagunitas never disappoints me, and this is one of my favorites from them. It also helps that they keep their bombers reasonably priced. This was the third one Ive tried over the last month, and hopefully not my last

Poured into a pint glass out of a 22oz bomber.

Pours an opaque very dark brown with a billowy, fluffy dark tan head. Im surprised at how strong and long lasting the head is and it is very impressive for this strong of a beer.

Aroma is a great mixture of pine tar, earth and roasted, almost burnt malt. Slight dark chocolate and coffee notes underneath.

The flavor is even better than the aroma. Huge shot of pine and earth, almost like being in a pine forest. Just wet pine needles everywhere. This is complimented by a large amount of roasted malt with almost a charred character. The coffee and chocolate are much more subdued here. A touch of wet grass towards the finish with a high bitterness throughout.

Overall, I love this style and this is probably the best of the style I have had. Lagunitas never seems to disappoint and this is no exception. An excellent beer.

On tap at Joe Canals West Deptford.
Appearance: Opaque and murky chestnut hue with a tall and dense, slightly foamy, tan head.
Aroma: Orange with a hint of peach and mango with a dash of roasted malts and caramel.
Taste: I get big peach with orange and mango vying for attention with a mild malt base giving hints of chocolate, caramel and roast. Bitterness is kept mild with the most of it being on the finish. Lingering peach and orange with a balanced flavor profile throughout and neither a dry or sweet finish.
Palate: Sort of pulpy body with soft carbonation, almost chewy.
Overall: This is a fine black IPA with great balance and a flavor profile that I enjoy. The price is right and this shows no hints of its 8.2%. Another great Lagunitas beer.

Pours dark brown with dense dark brown head. Aroma of citrus and a hint of pine. Flavor is grapefruit and tropical fruit hippiness. Finish is resinous and slightly roasty malty. This is a terrific IPA.

Location/Date:Bottle pour on June 7th split with Dave.
Appearance: Pours an opaque black.
Aroma: Aroma of pine, some chocolate.
Taste: Medium light bitterness, light roast, some chocolate.
Palate:Light medium body.
Summary: Lagunitas, the maker of consistently good IPAs of many varieties. Night Time is no different. A little more chocolate than others, but lighter on the body of which I appreciate.

22oz bomber bottled on May 14, 2014. Appearance is very dark brown and translucent in light. Head is light brown in color. Aroma consists of grapefruit peel, oranges, passion fruit, pine and only very slight roasted malt. Taste upfront is huge bitter grapefruit and pine. Get more of that passion fruit as well. The bitterness isnt the kind of hoppy, citrus rind bitterness but dark chocolate bitterness. The bitterness lingers and lingers until the next sip. Mouthfeel is smooth and quite creamy; medium-full bodied.

650ml bottle, thanks Jesse

Pours pitch black with a smooth brown head. Aroma of grassy hops, roasty malts, dark chocolate, coffee and smooth fruitiness. Taste is slick, smooth and hoppy with some mild roastiness, dark chocolate and smooth fruitiness. Finish is hoppy, bitter and slightly roasty with slick smoothness and grassy notes. Smooth and slick black IPA, tasty stuff.
Black color with a large head. Lighht pine and chalky aroma. Moderately bitter. Pine, dank. Very light roast character.

22 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 4/24/2014. Pours pitch black color with a 2 finger dense khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice soapy lacing clings around the glass, with some moderate streaming carbonation. Aromas of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, lemon zest, orange peel, citrus rind, pine, floral, grass, cocoa, roasted malt, light coffee, and floral/grassy earthiness. Damn nice aromas with bright citrus/grassy hops and moderate roasted malt presence; with great strength. Taste of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, lemon zest, orange peel, citrus rind, pine, floral, grass, cocoa, roasted malt, light coffee, and floral/grassy earthiness. Good amount of pine and moderate roasted bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, orange peel, citrus rind, floral, grass, pine, cocoa, roasted malt, light coffee, and floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Damn nice complexity of bright citrus/grassy hops with moderate roasted malt balance; with a great malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a smooth, fairly sticky/creamy, and lightly chalky mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is well hidden with only a slight warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent black IPA. All around great complexity and balance of bright citrus/grassy hops and moderate roasted malt flavor; and very smooth to drink for the ABV. A very enjoyable offering.
Bottle from Total Wine. Pretty beer. Pours black with a huge tan head. Smells hoppy and grassy. Taste matches the smell. I prefer the Wookie Jack, but this is still a nice Black IPA.

Pungent but pleasant grapefruit aroma contrasts with the thick light brown head. Lacing up and down the glass. Balanced but very complex toasted coffee and biscuit along with grapefruit flavors. Medium-bodied.

22 oz bottle from Mile High Wine & Spirits. Black appearance with a lacy tan head. Aroma of citrusy hops, pine, roasted malts and sweet fruits. Similar flavor, hoppy and roasty with medium bitterness. Medium body, pretty tasty stuff.

Bomber into Le Duvel - nose is resin and dark malts. Sip adds more IPA than black. Very easy to drink while retaining great flavor. Light body for the style and the bitterness is not as complex as I would expect. Latent coffee roast but mild at best. A great beer but not meeting expectations for the style.
This beer has it all. I was taken back by how much the hop was present both the taste and the smell. Lots of resin and dank flavor. This will become a regular in my fridge.

Everything a black IPA should be, the resiny hops jump out of the glass, raging with spicy intensity against the taste buds. Ends smoothly, however, with nary a wisp of bitterness to linger upon the palate. Some light toasty malt notes make their way into the party, but make no mistake; this is all about the hops. Tropical (mango?) fruits lend an airiness to the beer that belies its 8+% heritage.

2 oz. or smaller pour at St. Paul Summer Beer Fest. Consumed on 6-7-14. I am pretty sure this was a pour from a bottle. Pours dark brown with taupe head. Dank, piney aroma. Tangy, dry, roasted flavor features a coffee element. Medium to full body. Smooth, silky, and lively in the palate. This is a good and well made beer, one of the best I had at the festival.
22 oz bottle. Pours black with a large light tan head. Hoppy grapefruit pine aroma with some darker hints. Roasty hoppiness, pine and grapefruit, coffee and cocoa notes. A really good one.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2014 On tap and from the bomber at different times, amazing. Aroma is amazingly wet hop or something very fresh because I know lagunitas uses pellets. Flavour is awesome for a black ipa, citrusy, roasty, very well balanced. I always laugh about their day time/night time thing because that?s targets generic version of nyquil....
Bottle from tjs. A great black ipa w/solid hop presence in both aroma & flavor. Very enjoyable @ 8.6%.
Bomber. A really great black IPA at an awesome price as always from Lagunitas. Heavy citrus. Great balance.

Purchased at Binnys in Chicago, IL; enjoyed at home on a pleasant Saturday pre-evening watching baseball. Appearance is a dark murky brown with a thin tan head that lightly laces to the glass. Aroma of leafy hops, light caramel malt, light alcohol. Taste is heavy on malt, mostly caramel, light syrup, with a moderate bitter finish. Overall it's pretty good, enjoyable.

Draft to pint at Dutchs. Looks solid; a cloudy dark brown with foamy beige head. Smells solid too; tropical hops and dark malt with notes of chocolate. Pleasant on the palate. A good Black (Brown) IPA.

A wonderful black IPA. Pours a very dark brown with off white head and lacing. Great dank resinous aromas.. Notes of sweet chocolate too. Flavors are semi sweet chocolate, dank and meaty hops with a bitter burnt coffee finish. Phenomenal stuff.

Bottle, shared around the table at game night (Caverna!). Very dark brown, opaque body, with a generous frothy ecru head that recedes to chunky flotsam. Massively fragrant hop aroma of tropical fruits, light pine, with dark undertones. Complex aromatic hop pot-pourri, papaya, grapefruit, guava, perfumey pine, with generous dark malts in support. Big flavours, great balance, long bitterness. Beautiful.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Draft. Poured clear dark brown with an average frothy tan head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy toasted malt, earthy hop with a small alcohol aroma. Medium to full body with a dry slick texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy dark bittersweet flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate to long duration. This is a very good complex beer.
Bomber thanks to respertftw. Dark brown with a tan head. Strong citrusy hops. Malty and bright hops.

Bomber from Sendiks in Brookfield. Pours cola colored with a light tan head, leaving some spots of lace. Aroma has pine and citrus and grassy hops. Further down in the glass some caramelly malts, some chocolate and a bit of ginger kicked in. Very nice, sweet and hoppy smell. Taste is of pine, chocolate, some grapefruit and some caramel. With grass. Medium bodied without any alcohol presence. Finishes nicely blended between bitter and sweet and fruity. Very solid for style. One of Lagunitas best!

6 June 2014, bottle. Dark brown/black. Nose is some dark malt and moderate almost stale pine hops. Thin body and mildly fizzy. Really crisp. Pine hops, some sweet maple syrup, dark chocolate, bitter finish. Decent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Park Lane in Hampton. Cola colored with a short tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, pine, chocolate covered oranges, and hop resins. Taste is roasted malt, floral, chocolate, hop resins, orange rind and pine notes. Body is medium with a moderate bubbly carbonation. Finishes with more floral hops, citrus, pine notes, chocolate, light cocoa and caramel notes.

22oz bomber poured into a shaker. A strong pine-hop note is picked up initially by the nose, followed by some chocolate malt and some hot butterscotch. The beer itself is a deep, dark red-brown clear color with a sudsy, puffy, light tan colored head. A generous puff of head is retained through to the end of the drink, and it leaves a decent amount of messy, soapy lace. The beer has a taste of medium - high bitter with a medium sweet background note. The creamy textured beer is helped along by an abundance of soft carbonation. The medium-full body finishes with a strong fig and citrus zest touch and some background notes of chocolate malt, cola, and some caramel. Theres also a distinct marijuana touch in there. The finish is a herb / hoppy grass with a touch of cola. The aftertaste is light and doesnt linger long.
Dark brown fade to black color that smells of cherries and earthy malts. Taste is hops, sweet caramel, chocolate, and wheat. Complex and warming while still maintaining the hop character.

Draft at Victory 44. Smells a lot like surly blakkr. Floral hop nose with distinct roasted malt. Black body with thin tan head. Sheet lace. Excellent although it tastes identical to a beer Ive had before.
Dark, almost black pour. Big creamy off white head. Tons of lacing. Huge danky orange aroma. Taste is a bitter orange peel. Earthy and dry.

Tap. Pours dark brown with creamy off-white head. Aroma is lightly roasted malts, cocoa, earthy notes, light spice,and raisins. Flavor is flavorful with some roast, chocolate, earthy hops, dark fruit, and some spice; dry finish with some lingering bitterness. Medium body and carbonation.

Draft at Dutchs. Pours an amber tinted brown color with a medium sized creamy beige head. The aroma has a nice burst of resiny hops. The flavor has roasted malt, chocolate and citrus hops that cut the resin just a bit. Some herbal and earthy character. There is good balance between the malts and hops. Solid black IPA.

Aroma of cocoa, coffee bean oil, vanilla, toffee, dark grain malts and hops. Black appearance with a finger of foam. Taste is chalky with notes of cocoa nibs, dark chocolate, espresso, and toffee upfront with a bitter dry hop finish and also faint citrus, tangerine, plum and grapefruit from the hops. Finish is dry with residual toffee and nougat notes. Overall, this is very good and well balanced. Dry with roasty overtones. A+ rating.

Dark brown with ruby highlights, two-finger tan head and very nice lace. Aromas of grapefruit, pineapple, roasted malt and dark fruits with a hint of chocolate. Flavors are similar, with some pine resin notes poking through the crisp bitterness, supported by chocolate and dark fruits. Medium body, moderate carbonation, creamy mouthfeel, and a crisp hoppy finish.

Pours black with a nice lasting head. Aroma of hops, chocolate, lychee and berries. Taste is more like an IPA than the color would make you believe. Bitter hops and grass with a nice balance of a bit of roastiness.

Dark red brown pour
Aroma of grassy hops slight charcoal grapefruit
Tastes juicy grass, bready, caramel. Bitterness that blends in with the fruit flavors naturally. 
Slight creamy palate. A lot of balanced flavor for the price.
Dark mahogany pour with a tightly packed latte head. Roasted nuts, toffee, dark fruit, and citrus bitterness. Invisible alcohol. Not the hoppiest, not the maltiest...but nicely paired.

Sample at the Big Tap In on 05/31/2014. Pours nearly black with a medium foamy beige head that recedes steadily. Strings of lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, hops and fruit. Medium to full body with flavors of roast malt, licorice, fruit and piney hops. The finish is malty up front with a resiny hops aftertaste. Pretty good all around.
Grapefruit hops from start to finish. Some roast addition. Excellent black IPA. Would make a great year-around.
Tap. Dark malt with pine hops. Sweet and medium body. Good, but not great for a black IPA.

Bomber from Whole Foods. Pours dark brown with big, long-lasting khaki head, leaving behind irregular lacing. Herbal hops atop chocolate and caramel, with occasional whiffs of alcohol. Taste starts big on chocolate with a huge roasty middle giving way to a pronounced lasting bitterness. Overall: Very nice all around, and a bargain at only $4.99.

Very complicated aroma of roasted malt (similar to Guinness), strong pine hops, charcoal, weed (I heard it smells like this) and beef boullion. I couldnt stop smelling it. The only thing that slightly spoils the aroma for me is that it has traces of B.O. Pours black as night with paradoxically light off-white foam. Looks way more like a stout than a black IPA. Taste is very smoky, charcoal-esque, faint hop bitterness, not much else. I like the smoke, but I could have used more depth. The palate is a little watery, I have found most black IPAs to be this way. Overall very unique, reasonably priced, I cant say Ive had anything like it. That is not to say I would buy it again, but Im glad I tried it.

22 oz Bottle. Tasted on 6/2/14. Bottle from Total Wine & More. The aroma has citrus, roasted malt, mild chocolate hints, the Lagunitas scent on the nose. Taste was slightly tangy upfront followed by some citrus & dark notes finished by a very clean, dry with very little lingering taste. Overall a very good Black IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22oz. bottle. Dark Mahogany pour with some lacing. Citrus and roasty malt aromas. Balanced mix of dark malt flavors with pine and citrus. The bitterness leans into the backend and the sweetness in the front. Pretty good!

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2014 Pours a very dark brown/black with red highlights, and a finger of rocky head. Nose is floral hops, bit of resin, roast, theres something else that I cant pick out, maybe herbal, dank. Taste is roasty, hop flavor, dank, a bit of citrus juice. Moderate to low bitterness, moderate and smooth mouthfeel. Solid black ipa, but the dankness is throwing me. Sick bottle too. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is a seriously tasty black IPA. The roast is just the right amount, and this has a super smooth finish for the style. Excellent.

On tap at Harrikas Brew Haus in Swansboro NC. This is a dark black brown opaque brew with a thin head of cream bubbles. Nose is crisp floral hops with a bit of acrid tang. Taste is roasted malt with crisp floral hops. Body is a bit creamy but with a decent amount of bite. Finish is full of good resiny bitters.
Black with a light coloured head that looks like moonlight on clouds. Strong eucalyptus scent. Flavour is intense and amazing. Characteristic Lagunitas hopping in a delicious dark malt.
Pours black, good tan head. Aroma is a little dank citrus. Great mouth feel, full malt palette. Nice cda.

Aroma - clean crisp hop 

Appearance - nearly black. Large head. 

Mouth - med to low carb. Smooth. 

Taste - strange how the hop flavor hits and then dies at the start. Malts then show through then bitter aftertaste. 

Overall - this is my style. The hops are not too forward and disappear quick. This is really nice.

650ml bottle pours dark brown almost black in color with a finger of light brown head that leaves decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is citrus with some roasted grains and dark chocolate. Taste is a tropical and chocolate malty sweetness with a light roasted grain and citrus hop bitterness. Medium bodied with decent carbonation leaves a nice tickle on the tongue. A nicely done brew for the style and highly recommended.

Poured from the bomber into my Lagunitas mason jar. Dark brown almost black pour with a tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, some earthy hops and some licorice. Flavor is similar with a large dose of piney hops. Medium bodied with a slightly sticky mouthfeel and light astringency. Overall a very nice black IPA.

Poured from 22oz bottle. Poured dark brown almost black with a thick tan head. Aroma is citrus, tropical fruit, pineapple and hint of onion. Flavor starts out sweet caramel malt with citrus, tropical fruit and faint onion flavor. Finish is grapefruit. No lingering bitterness. The dark malt flavors dont really seem to come through in this beer. The malt just seems to really nicely balance this beer out. I really enjoyed this beer.

22 oz bomber. Black with a good sized beige head. Aroma is of pine, citrus, roasted malts, some resin. Taste is roasty with cocoa, pine, citrus, and resin, nice balance between the roasted malts and hops.

Pours nearly black, not quite a stout. Aromas of strong pine and some nice dank hops. Flavor is really nice with some resinous west coast hops taking over. Finishes fruity and crisp with a litter malty linger. Really a good black IPA for a style I dont care for much. At $5.99 a 22 Im not disappointed.
Great black IPA, really liked it from start to finish, had it at the craft beer fest and stood out as one of my favs out of many.
Fruity aromas of tropical fruits, mango or pineapple. Very smooth body. Super interesting flavors, very hoppy, floral, tangerines. Bright at the finish.
Big hoppy aromas, citrus fruit, resin, and roasty malts. Slightly hazy brown-black with a lasting beige head. Bitter, fruity hop notes, roast. Medium bodied, smooth but finishes sharp.
Aromas of fresh tropical hops and fresh fruitiness some pineapple. Off white lasting head and dark rusty amber body. Flavors of fresh hops and citrus flavors. Crisp on the palate.
22oz bottle. Pours dark cola colored. Aroma of peach, pineapple, with the slightest touch of pine and caramel. Flavor is tangerine, pineapple, mango, spruce. Awesome. Just awesome.
Dark pour huge brown head nice lacing. Big hippy aroma lots of citrus and some tropical fruits. Sweet caramels a clean lightly bitter swallow. Nom nom
Yum. Black Ipa that has a awesome hop aroma n taste. As w everything Ive tried by lagunitas this is a quality for a fair price and a high alcohol content.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with white head. Nose and taste of cocoa, tree sap, resinous pine and sarsaparilla. Medium body.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2014 Sampled on draft at 3R6P this beer poured almost black with orange highlights and a huge foamy beige head that lingered and left great lacing. The aroma was dryish and bitter with strong floral hops. The flavor was dry, bitter and roasty with a floral hop presence. Medium length finish. Medium body. Meh.

Has the standard IPA smell, but that dark look really throws you off, which is a good thing. The taste, I have to say I was expecting something a little more smokey or rich, but like the smell it really is the stand IPA but just dark. However I got this for $4.99 and with 8.2 ABV, you cant complain, great bang for our buck! I have to rate this high.

22oz bomber from Crossroads. Pours a dark brown/almost black color with a finger of creamy tan head. Aroma of sweet orange and grapefruit citrus, roasted malt, caramel, and chocolate as it warms. Taste of chocolate, burnt malts, oranges, lemon, grapefruit zest, and pine.

Opaque brown/black color, bubbly tan head cover, dots and blobs of lace. Roasted malt and pinr hops compete all the way to a long, lingering finish. Both sides win in an impressively balanced brew that has a big viscous mouthfeel. On the one hand, this is very simple, on the other hand, it is a well-crafted brew. Recommended.

22oz bottle picked up in Vacaville 
Clear dark brown with a big beige head and lots of lacing. Aroma of grapefruit, dark fruit and grassy. Taste is grapefruit, onion and pine 
Nice and smooth
HOT DAMN!! I thought this was going to be a malt bomb or some kind of syrupy sweet drink. Not at all! Dry! Cannabis-esque! Clean and flavorful!

Bottle poured into a tulip: Pours jet black with a foamy tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, resin, grass, and citrus fruit. The flavor is mildly malty, but is more than balanced out with the tropical, citrus, and slightly piney hops. Dry finish, a little strong on the carbonation, not at all boozy, medium to heavy body. This is an awesome beer.
This brew really raises the bar for what a black IPA should be. Not as malty and heavy as others. Medium lightness on the palate, full of hoppy flavor. Much better than expected.

Bottle @ Camping. Black pour with a khaki head. Wowe, such hops. Crazy grapefruit, pineapple, and pine aromas. Slight grass, some mango, and orange zest. Roasted malt and maybe a touch of toasted bread. This is dry and slightly roasty, but otherwise the hops shine through. Tons of fruity hop character. Nice juicy grapefruit and orange with a slight pineapple and peach sweetness. Plenty of bitter pine and roast on the finish. Thank you, Lagunitas for making a damn good black IPA instead of a crappy hopped up, chocolatey porter.

Pours almost black with some brown hues and a two finger tan head with excellent lacing. Aroma is of citrus, pine, roasted malts, coco, and some tropical fruits. Taste is citrus, pine, tropical fruits, roasted malts, dark coco, barnyard funk, iced coffee, earthy grassy hops, and some light sweet malts. Has a medium-full body with a super creamy mouthfeel and a semi dry, moderately bitter, long, hoppy yet also roasty finish. Overall, a very tasty, complex black IPA.

22 ounce bottle. Translucent deep reddish brown color. Thick rocky tan head. Complex roasted malt aroma with notes of citrus and pine hops. Flavor upfront is burnt caramel, coffee and earthy barnyard funk. Finish is dank and moody with a spicy, toasty, chewy mouthfeel.

Bottle from Champanes, 
this ale had a dark brown-black pour and presented a two to three finger light tan head that lowered to a lasting cover and ring, it left nice spots and rings of lacing on the glass, there was no sediment in the bottle, 

the nose had aromas of generous roasted malt with a little dark bread, citrus, resin and earthy herb hops, some caramel and brown sugar, 

it had flavors of bright roasted malt with pine and resin hops, dark caramel and a touch of coffee, dark sugar sweetness that has a hint of molasses, the roasted malt had notes of faint smoke and licorice like notes, 
the finish had a good hop bitterness with roasted malt afterwards, the hops hung around a bit on the tongue, 

the mouth feel was light to medium, it was creamy and had average carbonation, 

this ale was a very roasty and hoppy, it had a good bitter finish, I would recommend.
An extremely dark and murky tasting beer. This Ale will slow down your senses and make you feel around in the dark.

Pour out of 22 oz bottle, dark brownish black pour with off white head, aroma brought notes of roast, coffee, orange, grapefruit, hints of dark fruit, slight pine, grass, hints of mint in there as well. Taste is a mix of dark fruit, orange, hints of roast, coffee, cocoa, hints of herbal/minty note but it works well, finishing fairly grassy, piney, slightly sweet.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2016 Dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of pine and mango and grapefruit with some dank and earthy hop. Taste is very resiny but there is some juicy fruit and dank hops on there as well. Surprisingly smooth it is very well balanced. Finishes like a juicy ipa and warms nicely. This is a fantastic black ipa. Must try.---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Caramel, chocolate, grass, citrus, floral, citrus, herbs, woody, butterscotch clean sweetness and bitter front and back palate

Pours a dark brown with chestnut highlights, a big tan head that settles to a big dollop and leaves decent lacing. Aroma of big grapefruit and citrus at first and then the dankness and one comes forward as it warms, with some light roast and toffee in the background. Taste is grapefruit and dank resiny hops with a piney bitterness. Mild roasty flavors and a bit of cocoa. All the flavors blend to present an almost spicy rye flavor in the end. Finishes with a lingering bitterness. Medium bodied with moderate/high carbonation. Very hoppy and flavorful but still drinkable. An IPA at heart with nice hints of the dark malt flavors.

Pours dark walnut brown with a sticky, lacy tan-white head that fades to a rim and light coat. Aroma is lemon or grapefruit and sticky piney hops. Taste is dark roasted caramel malts under mildly bitter hoppy pine. Notes of grapefruit and florals. Some smokiness. Surprisingly creamy. Very well-balanced. Excellent black IPA. Lagunitas does it again.

Black pour under a generous foamy light beige head. The nose is super lovely featuring dank sweet grapefruit rind and sweet piney resins with a earthy floral leafiness, and an overall aroma of marajuana-ish tones (which I normally dont care for but here it was awesome), combined with a sweet darkish maltiness. The flavor was big and bold with dark roasted caramel, sweet char notes and a big complex hop bitterness featuring sweet pine resins and orange/grapefruit zest, some floral hops and wet hops, earthy tones with a semisweet dark malt finish (with a kiss of caramel).

22oz bottle pours dark rich brown black with 2 finger eggshell head.
Nose is juicy resinous pine, grapefruit, touch of roast, cocoa. Taste is clean subtle roast malt, pine, resin, grapefruit, bitter, bits of chocolate. Finish is nice balanced bitterness, lingering roasty cocoa and juicy piney citrus. Nice clean body doesnt get muddied by the dark malts. Great black IPA!
Poured from a bottle it is a dark brown color with a slight head the aroma is that of spruce and the taste is strong and bitter and ends with the sensation of. Black licorice
From a 22 oz bottle shared in Avon, NC. Pours a clear dark cola with a tan head. Plenty of citrus and roasted notes in the nose. Flavors of pine tar. Bitter finish

had on tap at the place i sit .. . pours a dark brown .. dont put your baby on me .. . medium foam .. . pretty roasty i guess, some scorched hops and a easy mouth feel .. . one of the milder bipas but it does seem to rise above that silly moniker .. . . im not a very competitive person im always the first to say it.

(22oz. Bottle) - Not overly huge head. Dark brown opaque body. Definite piney aroma. Resiny pine flavors at first with some orange traits. Not overpowering like some IPAs are. Good average body. At $4.99/btl this is a winner!

Bottle, 8.2%. Wild stuff! To oversimplify it, feels like a solid stout up front and a juicy West Coast IPA on the back end. But really its much more than that. Complex and wonderful. Flavors are balanced and integrated. Pretty sure this is the best Lagunitas Ive had and just about everything I want from a black IPA.

Poured from 22oz bomber into snifter, pours a very dark brown, almost black with a thin light brown head, aroma is nice, good amount of roast and chocolate with a hint of pine and citrus as well, the flavor has a sharper pine and hop front end with quite a bit of roast, chocolate lingers in the finish quite a bit and kind of stays around for a while, pretty nice stuff.

Bottle. Pours very dark brown-almost black with a beige creamy to frothy big lasting head that leaves plenty of lacing. Aroma of pine and soap. Light to medium bitter, medium sweet taste in a light to medium body with flavors of cereal, burnt malts and caramel. Thin to oily texture, average carbonation and a brief bitter finish. Doesnt hide the alcohol very well.
Tap at Blue Door Pub. Black with a creamy tan head. Heavy pine, smokey, burnt sugars and a slight ammonia aromas. Smokey up front with a piney bitter finish. Body is heavier with foamy feel.
Bomber pours black with tan head. Aroma is dark roast with floral and pine. Taste is medium bodied with a nice bitter roast finish.

resinous and spicy hop aroma. this black IPA pours really dark with minimal white head. tastes sweet and with a little bit of chile like spice and some slight bell pepper at first (??) but that went away after a couple sips.

overall, super piney. a little sugary sweet and a tad astringent. theres something a little vegetal in here with the bell pepper flavor that could also be a little bitter leafy green (like kale) in the bitterness. if i dont notice it this beer is good but something is rubbing me the wrong way about this one.
Bottle. Black pour with tan head. Spice, herbal hop aromas. Light spice, herbal hop flavor with a touch of roasted flavors. Chocolate and roasted flavors are the finish.
Good strong beer. Pours completely black, with a thickish white head. Very tasty, hopefully Ill be able to find it again.
Pours black with a medium off white head. Hippy Smokey aroma. Taste has notes of grape, grapefruit and leather. Finish is long and fruity.

Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate citrus and piney hops mixed with light-moderate cocoa, light roast, and a touch of perfume. It pours a dark brown with no transparency and a two finger beige head that leaves behind a thick sheet of lacing on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with moderate chocolate and caramel. The finish has moderate pine, lighter citrus, roast, and a touch of lemongrass. Its medium bodied with soft carbonation and mouthfeel. Overall, the lemongrass clashes with the roast in the finish.
Bottle. The look is dark, decent beige colored head, and black in color. The smell is pine, malts, roast, stone fruits, toast, and florals. The taste is burnt malts, toast, pine, fruits, acrid bite.

Bomber. Poured cola brown with a sticky khaki head. The aroma picked up fresh pine hoppage over roasty black malt.. light herbal accents worked well. The flavor found prickly black roast, piney hops, and carbonation on the tip of the tongue with dry, fairly generic black malts following.. fresh, moderate bitterness the whole way.. finished spicy, bitter, and quasi-refreshing. Medium-bodied with smooth, rolling carbonation.. good feel and flow.. nice one!
A lower ibu black ipa. Nicely done by one of the better brewers out there. Monster bottle wide be better in 12 Oz size.

22oz bomber from Xroads. Poured a big thick creamy light black body under a smaller tight creamy beige head. Aroma of semi-sweet chocolate morsels and lightly roasted orange slices, dark toast, roasted pineapple and earh. Big full creamy body with light carbination. Flavor of dark roast, light sweet oranges, well done toast, chocolate malt. Its ok but not the black IPA I was hoping for.

Pours a brown black with some very light khaki foam. Aroma is big citrus, grapefruit and orange with some grains underneath it. The flavor is more balanced with bitter roasted chocolate flavors and the big citrus hop punch works well. Lingering hoppy floral citrus with an interesting bitter from the grain and light chocolate lasting. Very well done lagunitas, totally is what Id hope for in a lagunitas black ipa.

Nice crisp black ipa. Black pour with red hue. Aroma of grapefruit and roasted malts. Piney taste, citrusy, resinous. Again a slight toasted taste. Long lasting bitterness. Good medium carbonation that brightened the beer...definitely more ipa than a hoppy stout.

Pours a deep brownish black from the bottle with thin cap of lacy tan head that webs lightly. Aroma of the typical west coast hop mix from lagunitas. Taste is more balanced with the roasty black malt, but still good hop presence. The aroma opens up to feature malt as it warms, mild carbonation, a bit of booziness in the belly as you drink more, a mild bitterness. Pretty nice.
Black pour with a thin head. Very toasty aroma, almost smokey. Some pine and lots of roasted malt. A dry bitterness thats very pleasant.

(bottle) Black with tan head and nice lace. Aroma of pine and a bit of grapefruit. Flavor is pine/grapefruit hops, some roast malt. Not as toasty/stout-like as some some black IPAs (which is a good thing).

Bottle. Pours black with a big foamy head that fades very slowly and leaves some thin lacing. Aroma is a great mix of fresh hops and roasted malt. Pine, flowers, cocoa, roast, and brown sugar. Tastes fairly sweet at first with some juicy citrus hops, turns very piney and floral, then finishes with roast and chocolate. Just a light hint of bitterness in the finish. Medium to thick body. Creamy and smooth mouthfeel. Ultra soft carbonation. Really good black IPA but not up there with my favorites.

Aroma is hop dominat - pine some florals. Pours a dark brown with a thin lasting tan head Nd a lot of lacing.the taste is rich careless, malts. florals, pine, and citrus. Excellent! Medium body and medium carbonation. Overall, a complex and rewarding beer.

Bomber->SA. Deep brown with frothy offwhite head leaving toms of lace. A: strong pine and grapefruit hops with roasted malt base. T: pine hops with roasted malt, smoke, burnt coffee.. Deep. Bitter aftertaste lingers, quite nice. Very good.

Opaque pour, off white head that hangs around. Piney, cat pee, aromatic hops, citrus, grapefruit. Bitter, resinous hops, balanced with roasted, coffee like malts, hints of liquorice, too. Lovely soft carbonation gives a balanced mouthfeel, leading to a pleasant bitter, spicy, drying finish.
Night black pour with thick vanilla head. Smells smokey and resin like.Medium body palate. Tastes of coffee grounds but in good way. Bitter in the front with a sweet and dry finish.

22 oz bottle. Pours a near black with burgundy hues when backlit. Lasting off white head and thick lacing. Aroma is roast malt, a slight coffee note, hop bitterness, and notes of bittersweet chocolate. Flavor is complex and same as aroma. Balanced malt and hops make for a very drinkable black IPA.

Bottle. Clear, black pour, big durable head, fantastic aroma of fresh hops. Flavor is balanced of malt and hops, with a piney, slightly resiny taste. Solid mouthfeel. Finishes with some good complexity to the hop bitterness. Nice, as expected from this brewer.

Pours black with a white head. Strong hop aroma that leads into a slightly roasty body. The hops and roasted malts blend really well and make a great black ipa. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours deep mahogany with lots of foam. Bitter hop nose with hints of pine and citrus. Very slight roast flavor with heavy hop palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown color with a small tan head. Aroma is citrus, floral and pine hops. Taste is a nice combo of citrus/pine hops thats quite strong for a black IPA; coffee, chocolate, dark malt as well. This is a lighter black IPA, which I like.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2015 Taster from a bottle at Moriartys during a Lagunitas event. Burnt dark caramel pour with a lingering soft halo of foam. Elements of a Black IPA - namely burnt hops - but there is a strong presence of coffee here not normally in a Black IPA. This combination should not work as well as it does. Despite the decent ABV, it seems to finish smoother than most IPAs (or coffees for that matter!) Nice bit of warming after the finish though. UPDATE: Found the draft of it over 6 months later at Varga. Did not feel as impressive as the bottle.

New Beer Distributors, NYC 650ml ($6): Pours black with a beige head. Aroma is coffee, roasted malts, and a whole hock of citrus hops. Taste is a spectacular combination of roasty bitterness with hoppy bitterness, topped off with a well-melded citrusy tinge. The citrus doesnt take it too far either. Nice lingering aftertaste. Good body.

Bottle @ home. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is a lot of citrus and pine hops with some roasy chocolate malt. Flavor is also citrus and pine with some caramel, chocolate malt. Nice black IPA
Bomber. Nice head. Aroma of caramelized malts and underlayed with hops. Silky smooth taste. Licorice and bitterness blended smoothly. One of the better Bipa.

22 oz. bomber from Raleys Market in Chico, CA.  Super juicy citrus and chocolate aromas rises off a medium dark brown body with a thick tan head. I dont know if Ive ever smelled something like that coming from a dark beer! That follows right into the flavor with a sweet orange taste that is immediately followed by a milk chocolate smoothness and taste, and then a drying, astringent bitterness and alcohol bite. All of this shouldnt make any sense at all, but it does here and its incredibly, perfectly balanced. Finishes with a lasting burn along with chocolate and dry citrus rind. Unlike the phrase on the bottle "Fear the Dark", I welcome it again and again.

Pours a deep cola brown with the merest hint of lighter brown around the edges, two fingers of thick, persistent mocha head, and heavy lacing. Nose is bright and hoppy, pine and citrus, with just a hint of malt. Taste is milder than expected from the nose but follows suit, leading out bitter... and... pretty much staying bitter, against a mild malt background. Mouth feel is medium bodied and dry as hell, with a lingering bitter finish.

This is one hell of a black IPA. Its not as unidimensional as a single hop, but the citrusy hops (Citra? Simcoe?) are far and away the dominant characteristic. (For a hop head like me, this is a good thing.) I found the alcohol to be well hidden in the flavour, and only apparent as a gentle warming as the bottle progressed. I could drink a hell of a lot of this.

Pours a deep dark caramel color with three fingers of grayish khaki foam. The nose is deep and mysterious with layers of tropical fruit, pine, some light roasted malt, hints of caramel, cocoa powder and some cola too.
